item.title: Jack add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "It is bad to be oppressed by a minority, but it is worse to be oppressed by a majority." -- Anonymous

item.title: Jack add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "Be generous before you are just. Do not temper mercy with justice." -- Anonymous

item.title: Jack add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "I talk nonsense at times, because sense is monotonous." -- Anonymous

item.title: Jack add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "We know that the doctrine of equality leads by steps not only logical, but almost mechanical, to sacrifice the principle of liberty to the principle of quantity; that, being unable to abdicate responsibility and power, it attacks genuine representation, and, as there is no limit where there is no control, invades, sooner or later, both property and religion." -- Anonymous

item.title: Jack add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "His one belief was the right of every man not to have, but to be, his best." -- Anonymous

item.title: Jack add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "liberty is not a means to a higher end, it is itself the highest political end." -- Anonymous

item.title: Jack add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "no State can command obedience if it does not deserve respect;" -- Anonymous

item.title: Jack add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "The deepest cause which made the French Revolution so disastrous to liberty was its theory of equality. Liberty was the watchword of the middle class, equality of the lower." -- Anonymous

item.title: Jack add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "Liberty has lost its spell; and democracy maintains itself by the promise of substantial gifts to the masses of the people." -- Anonymous

item.title: Jack add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "truth is the only merit that gives dignity and worth to history." -- Anonymous

item.title: Jack add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "Before a new authority can be set up in the place of one that exists, there is an interval when the right of dissent must be proclaimed." -- Anonymous

item.title: Jack add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "Death is a dignitary who when he comes announced is to be received with formal manifestations of respect, even by those most familiar with him." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Jack add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "The Christian notion of conscience imperatively demands a corresponding measure of personal liberty. The feeling of duty and responsibility to God is the only arbiter of a Christian's actions." -- Anonymous

item.title: Jack add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "A man must be orthodox upon most things, or he will never even have time to preach his own heresy." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Jack add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "the reality of modern capitalism is menacing that ideal with terrors and even splendours that might well stagger the wavering and impressionable modern spirit." -- Anonymous

item.title: Jack add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "The evil of journalism is not in the journalists. It is not in the poor men on the lower level of the profession, but in the rich men at the top of the profession; or rather in the rich men who are too much on top of the profession even to belong to it." -- Anonymous

item.title: Jack add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "but if the bank is stronger than the sword or the sceptre of popular sovereignty, the end will be the end of democracy." -- Anonymous
